problem.p: Consider a process plotted on the p â€“ T diagram of water. Its initial state is given by p[mathjaxinline]_1[/mathjaxinline] = p[mathjaxinline]_c[/mathjaxinline][mathjaxinline]/[/mathjaxinline]3 and T1 = T[mathjaxinline]_c[/mathjaxinline][mathjaxinline]/[/mathjaxinline]3 where 'p[mathjaxinline]_c[/mathjaxinline]' and 'T[mathjaxinline]_c[/mathjaxinline]' represent the critical point pressure and critical point temperature respectively.

The liquid having initial state (p[mathjaxinline]_1[/mathjaxinline],T[mathjaxinline]_1[/mathjaxinline]) is isobarically heated until its temperature becomes 2*T[mathjaxinline]_1[/mathjaxinline]and further it is isothermally compressed until its pressure becomes 3*p[mathjaxinline]_1[/mathjaxinline]. What is the final state of the fluid?

div.p: State 1: Referring to steam tables: Table 2, T[mathjaxinline]_{sat}[/mathjaxinline] (p[mathjaxinline]_1[/mathjaxinline]) = T[mathjaxinline]_{sat}[/mathjaxinline] (7.35 MPa) = 289.15 [mathjaxinline] ^\circ[/mathjaxinline]C
From table 3, we ensure that the given state lies in the subcooled or compressed liquid zone.
As T[mathjaxinline]_2[/mathjaxinline] < T[mathjaxinline]_c[/mathjaxinline], the given state lies in subcooled or compressed liquid zone
